column4: what's this problem wisdom@wisdom-laptop:~/Desktop$ sudo synclient Touchpadoff=0           Can't access shared memory area. SHMConfig disabled?
in order to use synclient, a special area of memory needs to be enabled. In default Ubuntu, it is not enabled
you need to edit your xorg.conf and the line Option SHMConfig "Enabled" in the section for the touchpad device
Doesn't work. I add this into my xorg.conf Option  "SHMConfig"  "Enable"
did you log out and log back in?
It doesn't work neither Enable nor On
I have it enabled for me and it works. Did you logout? changes to xorg.conf do not take effect until you logout. Plus it needs to be in the correct section.
Should I reboot? Or just ctrl+alt+backspace is enough?
ctrl-alt-backspace is enough. Try to avoid that because it abruptly closes x. Use the logout instead if you can.
should I close all the windows and applications?
you probably made the change in the wrong section of the xorg.conf
it should be in the section labeled Section "InputDevice" Identifier "Synaptics Touchpad"
that is exactly what I have in my xorg.conf and it works
you mean logout is better than ctrl+alt+backspace?
